title: Dirk Vekeman
text:
Dirk Vekeman (25 September 1960 – 5 May 2013) was a <a href="Belgium">Belgian</a> <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> player.
Club career.
He came through the youth ranks at <a href="R.S.C.%20Anderlecht">R.S.C. Anderlecht</a> and played 35 matches for their senior team. He was their second goalkeeper for several years behind <a href="Nico%20De%20Bree">Nico De Bree</a> and then <a href="Jacky%20Munaron">Jacky Munaron</a>, before season-long spells at fellow Brussels teams <a href="R.%20Jet%20Wavre">Racing Jet</a> and <a href="R.%20White%20Daring%20Molenbeek">RWDM</a>. He finished his career at <a href="K.%20Boom%20F.C.">F.C. Boom</a>, with whom he clinched promotion to the <a href="Belgian%20Pro%20League">Eerste klasse</a> in 1992.
